chunk_2_text: However after a period of 8 years Jane finally leaves Lowood. Now she's a teacher and is friends with most of the faculty. She puts an ad out in the local newspaper seeking for a job as a governess and her job application is answered by a Mrs. Fairfax. Jane moves to her new residence at Thornfield hall and looks after a little French girl named Adele until one day she's out walking. A man on a horse rides past her and he falls off. She helps the man back on the horse and tells him that she works in the nearby Thornfield hall. Jane soon finds out that this man is a certain Mr. Edward Fairfax Rochester and that is where the novel begins.
